TITLE.P: Community Health and Wellbeing Services for Children and Young People in Devon

SHORT_DESCR.P: NHS Northern, Eastern and Western Devon Clinical Commissioning Group, acting as lead commissioner for NHS South Devon and Torbay Clinical commissioning group, Plymouth City Council and Torbay Council seek to commission Community health and well-being services for children and young people in Devon.
Lot 1 — Community health and well-being services for children and young people in Devon — North, East, West Devon, South Devon and Torbay.
Lot 2 — Community health, well-being and Send support services — Plymouth.
This procurement is being managed by NHS South, Central and West Commissioning Support Unit Procurement Team on behalf of the Commissioners.

TITLE.P: Community Health and Well-being Services for Children and Young People in Devon — North, East, West Devon, South Devon and Torbay

MAIN_SITE.P: North, East, West Devon, South Devon and Torbay.

SHORT_DESCR.P: NHS Northern, Eastern and Western Devon Clinical commissioning group, acting as lead commissioner for NHS South Devon and Torbay Clinical commissioning group and Torbay Council seek to commission Community health and well-being services for children and young people in North, East, West Devon, South Devon and Torbay.

A section 75 agreement will be in place between Devon County Council and Northern, Eastern and Western Devon Clinical commissioning group for the commissioning of some of the services in this procurement.
The services included in this lot are detailed below.
Emotional health and well-being:
Child and adolescent community mental health services (CAMHs).
Children looked after nursing service.
Nursing and administration contribution to the Multi-agency safeguarding hub (MASH) processes.
Children’s learning disability and Autism spectrum disorders (ASD).
Send and children with additional needs and long term conditions:
Nursing and community support to include:
Community children’s nursing (incl. specialist school nursing; Palliative care).
Neuro disability and Integrated therapies to include:
Children’s speech and language therapy (incl. Early years language consultant Torbay).
Children’s occupational therapy (NHS and social care).
Children’s physiotherapy.
Specialist Children’s Assessment Centres.
The contract will be for 7 years with an option to extend for one period of 3 years. The annual contract value is circa GBP 24 000 000 per annum.
Procurement documentation can be obtained from: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/scwcsu/aspx/Home
This procurement is being carried out by NHS South, Central and West Commissioning Support Unit (SCW) on behalf of the Commissioners.

The Contracting Authority has an existing contract with Vranch House which include Children and Young People’s Physiotherapy services. The successful tenderer will be mandated to use Vranch House as a material subcontractor. Details are provided in the service strategy.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The contract will be for a term of 7 years (1.4/2019 – 31.3.2026). At the end of the 7 year term the commissioner will have one extension option for a further 3 year period.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: At the end of the initial 7 year contract term the Commissioner will have one extension option for a further 3 year period.

INFO_ADD.P: The Commissioners reserve the right to modify the contract under Regulation 72 of the Public Contracts Regulations (2015).
The contract value may increase between 6 % and 15 % with the possible addition of services during the lifetime of the contract. These services are detailed in the procurement documentation.

TITLE.P: Community Health, Wellbeing and Send support services – Plymouth

SHORT_DESCR.P: NHS Northern, Eastern and Western Devon Clinical commissioning group, acting as lead commissioner for Plymouth City Council seek to commission Community health, well-being and Send support services for Plymouth.
The services included in this lot are detailed below.
CAMHs (including severe learning disability).
Children’s speech and language therapy.
Public health nursing.
Safeguarding and children looked after.
Clinical and administrative staff.
The contract will be for 7 years with an option to extend for one period of 3 years. The annual contract value is circa GBP 13 000 000 per annum.
Procurement documentation can be obtained from: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/scwcsu/aspx/Home
This procurement is being carried out by NHS South, Central and West Commissioning Support Unit (SCW) on behalf of the Commissioners.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The contract will be for a term of 7 years (1.4.2019 – 31.3.2026). At the end of the 7 year term the Commissioner will have one extension option for a further 3 year period.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: At the end of the initial 7 year contract term the Commissioner will have one extension option for a further 3 year period.

INFO_ADD.P: The Commissioner reserves the right to modify the contract under Regulation 72 of the Public Contracts Regulations (2015).
The contract value may increase between 6 % and 15 % with the possible addition of services during the lifetime of the contract. These services are detailed in the procurement documentation.

SUITABILITY.P: Criteria stated in the procurement documents.

INFO_ADD.P: Interested providers will be able to view this notice via the 'current tenders' list on the e-procurement portal (In-tend). https://in-tendhost.co.uk/scwcsu/aspx/Home
In order to submit a bid, you will need to register on the e-procurement portal and 'express an interest' and then complete all necessary questions as specified within the documents.
On registration, please include at least 2 contacts to allow for access to the portal in times of absence.

The services are healthcare services falling within Schedule 3 to the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 ("the Regulations") which are not subject to the full regime of the Regulations, but is instead governed by the "Light touch regime" contained within Chapter 3, Section 7 of the Regulations (Regulations 74 to 77).

The tendering process will be conducted in accordance with the requirements and flexibilities provided by Articles 74 to 76 of the Directive, and Regulations 74 to 76 of the Regulations. The Authority will run a transparent tender process, treating all Bidders equally. For the avoidance of doubt, the Authority will not be bound by the Regulations or the Treaty on the functioning of the European Union or any other regulations or legislation except for the specific parts or circumstances that apply to the procurement of these services.

Neither the inclusion of a bidder selection stage, nor the use of any language or terms found in the directive or regulations, nor the description of the procedure voluntarily adopted by the Authority ("Open", "Restricted", "Competitive Procedure with Negotiation", "Competitive Dialogue" or any other description), nor any other indication, shall be taken to mean that the Authority intends to hold itself bound by the directive or regulations, save by the provisions applicable to services coming within the scope of Annex XIV of the directive / Schedule 3 of the regulations.

The Contracting Authority intends to voluntarily observe the award decision notices provisions and 10 day standstill period described in Regulation 86 of the regulations. Unsuccessful bidders will receive scores and reasons for the decision, including the characteristics and relative advantages of the winning bid and the reasons why the bidder/application was unsuccessful. Deadline for lodging of appeals should be in accordance with Regulation 87 and Regulation 91 of the regulations.
